definition: to damage the country and cause suffering to the people (idiom)

sentences.english: To sum up all, uprisings have been disastrous.
sentences.chinese: 總之，暴動是件禍國殃民的事。

definition: lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to act rashly/to act precipitously regardless of the consequences/reckless/foolhardy/daredevil
lit. a dagger hidden in smiles (idiom); friendly manners belying hypocritical intentions/when the fox preaches, look to the geese
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
to whisper to one another's ear
